types.name: Query
types.description: graphql queries: anything that retrieves data scoped to the logged in user

fields.name: devices
fields.description: retrieves all user devices, if deviceId is passed only returns one

fields.name: device
fields.description: retrieves a single devices current state based on deviceId

fields.name: logs
fields.description: retrieves all user device logs filtered by inputs

fields.name: pendingJobs
fields.description: retrieves all pending jobs for the provided device

fields.name: allJobs
fields.description: retrieves all consumer jobs for the provided device

fields.name: replenishmentToken
fields.description: retrieves an AWS access token for replenishment

fields.name: sessions
fields.description: retrieves all user brushing sessions filtered by inputs

fields.name: user
fields.description: retrieves User details for logged in user

fields.name: consumables
fields.description: retrieves all user consumables

fields.name: rssi
fields.description: received signal strength indicator (wifi) - rfrssi Values: 65 and above (good/green),80 to 65 (okay, yellow), 80 and below (bad, red) - only updated when device moves bands (ex. good to bad, bad to okay)

fields.name: ssid
fields.description: wifi network name

fields.name: voiceAssistantConfigured

fields.description: session count totalizer - updated in the session status stream

fields.description: current state of the consumable, when a new consumable is created our mutation will automatically set this to IN_USE and set previous consumable to USED.

types.name: ID
types.description: Built-in ID

types.name: AWSDateTime
types.description: The `AWSDateTime` scalar type provided by AWS AppSync, represents a valid ***extended*** [ISO 8601 DateTime](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601#Combined_date_and_time_representations) string. In other words, this scalar type accepts datetime strings of the form `YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.SSSZ`.  The scalar can also accept "negative years" of the form `-YYYY` which correspond to years before `0000`. For example, "**-2017-01-01T00:00Z**" and "**-9999-01-01T00:00Z**" are both valid datetime strings.  The field after the two digit seconds field is a nanoseconds field. It can accept between 1 and 9 digits. So, for example, "**1970-01-01T12:00:00.2Z**", "**1970-01-01T12:00:00.277Z**" and "**1970-01-01T12:00:00.123456789Z**" are all valid datetime strings.  The seconds and nanoseconds fields are optional (the seconds field must be specified if the nanoseconds field is to be used).  The [time zone offset](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601#Time_zone_designators) is compulsory for this scalar. The time zone offset must either be `Z` (representing the UTC time zone) or be in the format `Â±hh:mm:ss`. The seconds field in the timezone offset will be considered valid even though it is not part of the ISO 8601 standard.

types.name: AWSJSON
types.description: The `AWSJSON` scalar type provided by AWS AppSync, represents a JSON string that complies with [RFC 8259](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc8259).  Maps like "**{\\"upvotes\\": 10}**", lists like "**[1,2,3]**", and scalar values like "**\\"AWSJSON example string\\"**", "**1**", and "**true**" are accepted as valid JSON and will automatically be parsed and loaded in the resolver mapping templates as Maps, Lists, or Scalar values rather than as the literal input strings.  Invalid JSON strings like "**{a: 1}**", "**{'a': 1}**" and "**Unquoted string**" will throw GraphQL validation errors.

fields.name: parentDeviceId

fields.name: pressureDistribution
fields.description: every second is represented with a character: (under pressure = 1, good pressure = 5, over pressure = 9)

fields.name: pressureDuration
fields.description: over pressure time in seconds, from handle BLE.

fields.name: pressureEventCount
fields.description: total times high pressure was triggered during session

fields.name: primaryBrushingMode
fields.description: brush mode that was used most during session

fields.name: rinseMouth
fields.description: user polled question: Did you rinse? (DISABLED, NO, YES)

fields.name: sessionStartTime
fields.description: start time of session provided by gateway (app, charger, etc.) as ISO 8601 Time string (Use UTC if timezone is unknown - apps should check timezone before sending session data to account for traveling users)

fields.name: sessionType
fields.description: where the session is coming from

types.name: AWSEmail
types.description: The `AWSEmail` scalar type provided by AWS AppSync, represents an Email address string that complies with [RFC 822](https://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc822.txt). For example, "**username@example.com**" is a valid Email address.

types.name: NotificationPreference
types.description: enum to represent notification preferences

types.name: AWSPhone
types.description: The `AWSPhone` scalar type provided by AWS AppSync, represents a valid Phone Number. Phone numbers are serialized and deserialized as Strings. Segments of the phone number may be whitespace delimited or hyphenated.  The number can specify a country code at the beginning. However, United States numbers without country codes are still considered to be valid.

types.name: Mutation
types.description: graphql mutations: anything that creates or updates

fields.name: createConsumable
fields.description: creates a consumable for the device

fields.name: createDevice
fields.description: creates a new instance of a device associated with the signed in user, returns cert/private key if applicable

fields.name: createJob
fields.description: creates a task for the device to do, with guarantees using IoT Jobs

fields.name: cancelJob
fields.description: cancels IOT jobs

fields.name: createSession
fields.description: creates a new brushing session

fields.name: createSubscription
fields.description: Creates a replenishment for the user based on the type provided

fields.name: createReplenishment
fields.description: Creates a replenishment for the user based on the type provided

fields.name: deleteDevice
fields.description: deletes a device from the user and IoT Core

fields.name: deleteSession
fields.description: deletes a applicator session from a user's account

fields.name: deleteSubscription
fields.description: delete the user from the replenishment service

fields.name: deleteReplenishment
fields.description: delete the user from the replenishment service

fields.name: deleteUser
fields.description: deletes all user information, auth will be revoked

fields.name: placeOrder
fields.description: Tells the replenishment to place an order immediately. This will also reset the next order date

fields.name: updateConsumable
fields.description: updates an existing consumable

fields.name: updateDevice
fields.description: updates any mutable attributes on the Device

fields.name: updateUser
fields.description: updates any mutable attributes on the User

fields.name: updateSession
fields.description: updates device id or parent device id on the Session

fields.name: updateBrushingSession
fields.description: updates device id or parent device id on the Session

fields.name: sessionStream
fields.description: MQTT invoked local resolver

types.name: __Schema
types.description: A GraphQL Introspection defines the capabilities of a GraphQL server. It exposes all available types and directives on the server, the entry points for query, mutation, and subscription operations.

fields.name: types
fields.description: A list of all types supported by this server.

fields.name: queryType
fields.description: The type that query operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: mutationType
fields.description: If this server supports mutation, the type that mutation operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: directives
fields.description: 'A list of all directives supported by this server.

fields.name: subscriptionType
fields.description: 'If this server support subscription, the type that subscription operations will be rooted at.

types.name: __TypeKind
types.description: An enum describing what kind of type a given __Type is

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a scalar.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an object. `fields` and `interfaces` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an interface. `fields` and `possibleTypes` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a union. `possibleTypes` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an enum. `enumValues` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an input object. `inputFields` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: LIST
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a list. `ofType` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: NON_NULL
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a non-null. `ofType` is a valid field.

types.name: __DirectiveLocation
types.description: An enum describing valid locations where a directive can be placed

enumValues.name: QUERY
enumValues.description: Indicates the directive is valid on queries.

enumValues.name: MUTATION
enumValues.description: Indicates the directive is valid on mutations.

enumValues.name: FIELD
enumValues.description: Indicates the directive is valid on fields.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Indicates the directive is valid on fragment definitions.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_SPREAD
enumValues.description: Indicates the directive is valid on fragment spreads.

enumValues.name: INLINE_FRAGMENT
enumValues.description: Indicates the directive is valid on inline fragments.

enumValues.name: SCHEMA
enumValues.description: Indicates the directive is valid on a schema SDL definition.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Indicates the directive is valid on a scalar SDL definition.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates the directive is valid on an object SDL definition.

enumValues.name: FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Indicates the directive is valid on a field SDL definition.

enumValues.name: ARGUMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Indicates the directive is valid on a field argument SDL definition.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Indicates the directive is valid on an interface SDL definition.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Indicates the directive is valid on an union SDL definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Indicates the directive is valid on an enum SDL definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM_VALUE
enumValues.description: Indicates the directive is valid on an enum value SDL definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates the directive is valid on an input object SDL definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Indicates the directive is valid on an input object field SDL definition.

directives.name: include
directives.description: Directs the executor to include this field or fragment only when the `if` argument is true

directives.name: skip
directives.description: Directs the executor to skip this field or fragment when the `if`'argument is true.

directives.name: defer
directives.description: This directive allows results to be deferred during execution

directives.name: aws_cognito_user_pools
directives.description: Tells the service this field/object has access authorized by a Cognito User Pools token.

args.name: cognito_groups
args.description: List of cognito user pool groups which have access on this field

directives.name: aws_auth
directives.description: Directs the schema to enforce authorization on a field

args.name: cognito_groups
args.description: List of cognito user pool groups which have access on this field

directives.name: aws_api_key
directives.description: Tells the service this field/object has access authorized by an API key.

directives.name: aws_lambda
directives.description: Tells the service this field/object has access authorized by a Lambda Authorizer.

directives.name: aws_oidc
directives.description: Tells the service this field/object has access authorized by an OIDC token.

directives.name: aws_publish
directives.description: Tells the service which subscriptions will be published to when this mutation is called. This directive is deprecated use @aws_susbscribe directive instead.

args.name: subscriptions
args.description: List of subscriptions which will be published to when this mutation is called.

directives.name: aws_iam
directives.description: Tells the service this field/object has access authorized by sigv4 signing.

directives.name: aws_subscribe
directives.description: Tells the service which mutation triggers this subscription.

args.name: mutations
args.description: List of mutations which will trigger this subscription when they are called.
